Detailed Description

Interface class for position updates.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::LocationInterface::lbsStarted (  ) 

Checks if the lbs engine is started or not.

Returns:
The status LBS_STATUS_STARTED if the lbs has been started, LBS_STATUS_NOT_STARTED if the lbs has not been started.

void WFAPI::LocationInterface::replayNMEAData ( const char *  fileName,
int  begin = 0,
int  end = -1 
)

Parses a file of properly formatted NMEA data and replays it with 1 second intervals.

Parameters:
fileName The name of the file to parse.
begin The first message to use, messages before this was discarded
end The last message to use, messages after this will be discarded

AsynchronousStatus WFAPI::LocationInterface::requestReverseGeocoding ( const LocationUpdateInformation &  location  ) 

Request a reverse geocoding from a specified location. The reply will asynchronously be sent to registered geocoding listeners.

Parameters:
location The location that is to be looked up.
Returns:
A status indicating whether the request was successful or not.

AsynchronousStatus WFAPI::LocationInterface::requestReverseGeocoding ( const AreaUpdateInformation &  locationArea  ) 

Request a reverse geocoding from a specified area. The reply will asynchronously be sent to registered geocoding listeners.

Parameters:
locationArea The area that is to be looked up.
Returns:
A status indicating whether the request was successful or not.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::LocationInterface::setLocationHardware ( wf_uint8  hardware  ) 

Set the Location hardware to use right now. Not calling this method will cause the library to use all available hardware. If startLbs() has been called before this function is called, the api will respond with a callback on the users startedLbs(), after the hardware change is complete. If not, the callback to lbsStarted() will arrive after the startLbs() is called (if successful).

Parameters:
hardware The hardware to use. WF_MAX_UINT8 = all available hardware, 0 = no hardware, 1 = gps only, 2 = CellID only, 3 = gps and CellID,
Returns:
The status of the operation, OK if operation succeeded and either a status from StatusCode or LocationStatusCode.

AsynchronousStatus WFAPI::LocationInterface::startLbs (  ) 

This asynchronous function starts up the LBS. When operation is done the added LocationListeners will get a callback to startedLbs if successfully started, otherwise error will get called with a error code from StatusCode or LocationStatusCode

Returns:
The status and if status is OK.

SynchronousStatus WFAPI::LocationInterface::stopLbs (  ) 

Stop LBS updates.

Returns:
The status of the operation, OK if operation succeeded and either a status from StatusCode or LocationStatusCode.
